intro: Uragoga subaeneofusca, commonly known as the dark-barked uragoga, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, which has a dark, almost blackish bark, and its large, palmately lobed leaves. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color, and it is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
